name: Sakura
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
December 2023
,
·
Stayed with kids
review_text:
Wonderful Airbnb!! Spacious, clean, comfortable, well-lot and well-decorated. Loved it all- bedrooms, kitchen, bathroom… As others have mentioned, the back entrance looks sketchy but once you’re inside, it’s beautiful. There’s some noise from the cars on Girard St but wasn’t a big deal for us, and earplugs were provided. We liked hearing the occasional train go by. As we were traveling with an infant, we really appreciated the fridge/tons of kitchen counter space (we didn’t cook, just reheated pizza) and washer/dryer. There are lots of books and some toys for older kids too! A pleasant walk to downtown Bellingham, and closer walk to the Fountain district businesses.
(Tip esp if arriving after dark: The house is on the corner of I and Girard, and the driveway is off Girard St. As described in the instructions, but we missed it.)

It worked well for a girls’ trip away as we enjoyed the space of each having our own room but also had the cosiness of the tv area and kitchen to share meals and good conversation. Walking to restaurants and shops downtown was a easy 15mins and the hosts provided a good list of cafe, brewery and restaurant options. Thank you, Lindsy and Eli!

One of the best places we’ve stayed with our child so far! He’s 4 and this place had some toys and books he could enjoy as well as very little clutter or things he could break. This allowed for a much more relaxed stay for all of us as my husband and I didn’t have to be overly vigilant to keep him out of things he shouldn’t be in. Definitely a place I consider family friendly.
I also appreciated the advanced communication from Lindsy and Eli because I knew what to expect when we got there. They also provided an excellent resource for things to do and places to go.

Lots of kitchen amenities - variety of pots, pans, cooking essentials, seasonings/sauces, DISHWASHER - great for people who love to cook away from home! Be aware upstairs residents will be home sometimes, but we basically never heard them and no one came into or approached our space (or even our entrance and car).
No issues with stay.

Stayed with kids
review_text: This was a lovely space to stay in for an extra-long weekend in Bellingham. The beds are extremely comfortable, and the kitchen, bathroom and laundry are all modern, clean and spacious. My family really appreciated the video projector and how easy it was to navigate. We held off on watching a movie, expecting it to be complicated, and when we finally sat down to watch one, it couldn't have been easier. My kids especially loved the record player. The space is a short walk to a great coffee shop and a few restaurants and only slightly longer walk to downtown. Lindsy and Eli left great recommendations for restaurants, bars, and coffee shops that we took advantage of during our time. I definitely recommend Bellingham and this house for a visit!

Rating, 4 stars

,

Stayed with kids
review_text:
We recently stayed at the bottom unit and overall, it was a good experience. The location was walkable to downtown Bellingham, but we found it challenging to find a good way to navigate with a family and stroller. Being close to Elizabeth park and having a parking spot were definite highlights for us.
At first, it was a bit tricky to figure out how to get into the unit, but we managed. We weren't bothered by the street noise or train noise that others mentioned. The children's items and toys was a lovely touch, as we were traveling with a 5-year-old and a 1-year-old who shared a room.
The host responded quickly to any questions we had.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: We loved staying in Lindsy & Eli's place! The furnishings & decor are beautiful and the beds were so comfortable. It's a little funky on the outside but once you get in, it's so peaceful with lots of light & space. It is a little noisy being on a busy street but the street quiets down at night, thankfully. Our teenager geeked out over the record player & we had fun watching soccer on the big projection TV. We will definitely stay here again if we make it back to Bellingham!

The home was cozy & comfortable, with space to both work and lounge.
The TV being a projector was also a nice touch, as it allows for the room to feel light & airy when not in use.
The home is also sunny while staying cool, and is nicely laid out. If it does get warm, the ceiling fans are a big help.
It’s near to local businesses & the parking is easy to get in & out of.
If needing a place to stay in Bellingham in the future, I’d consider staying again.

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was SUCH an adorable place for us to spend the night. We walked in and immediately smiled seeing all the personality this place had to offer. The record player and stack of vinyl records were immediately put to use. Frank Sinatra helped us unpack. Our hosts sent us a lovely list of all the great places to eat dinner, grab a beer, enjoy a coffee, and spend some time outdoors. After we had dinner we came home and popped some popcorn and enjoyed a movie on the big screen. What a fun surprise to get to enjoy. Bonus - the couch is super comfy! We appreciated the fans for each room. We slept with the windows open for fresh air and felt entirely safe. Bellingham is a gem. Excited to go back some time.

review_text: When you first enter through the rear (from parking area), you may wonder what you have gotten yourself into. After you pass through the third door, things improve. The house is spacious; furnishings appropriate; beds comfortable. It's a cute old house, renovated. The renovations have not reached into every corner of the house. Updated windows are good. Much has been said about the street noise in the house--we did not experience any problem with noise.

Overall, we were happy with the spot!

Although there are other people living on the upper floor, they were very quiet and we had no issues with them at all.

Really loved the plants & antique-inspired touches 🌱 They even had children's books and toys for our little one to enjoy. So grateful for such a beautiful place to rest--thanks Lindsy & Eli!

review_text: I have stayed in a lot of Airbnb’s and I have to say this was one of the best. The space is wonderfully designed, spotlessly clean, and equipped with high end appliances. The house was quiet, receives a lot of light, and is a 5 minute drive to downtown Bellingham. It has its own dedicated parking space (actually two!) conveniently located next to the back door. And best of all, the bed (it has two- I only used one), was one of the most comfortable beds I’ve ever slept in, and the bedding was super high quality. I mention this because this is usually not the case in many Airbnb’s. But I slept great both nights I was there because the hosts made this a priority for their guests. I will definitely be back.

review_text:
This place was amazing! We had the ground floor apartment. There was a family upstairs but we barely heard them. The entire inside was renovated and modern, with many decorations from the places the hosts have travelled or lived. The kitchen had everything we might need, and the living room had a projector. We felt like we were at the movies. Both bedrooms were comfortable, with bedside lamps, charging stations, and even ear plugs!
We were only a mile from shops and restaurants in Bellingham. We visited Neko cat cafe (recommend), grabbed a few groceries from Grocery Outlet (to go with the yummy Samish Bay Cheese we got on the way up), and then had a delicious brunch at the Mount Bakery. We were about a ten minute drive to Fairhaven, where we hit up Village Books.
It was a quick stay, but I would definitely like to come back!

review_text: Great place, clean, comfortable, spacious. We enjoyed the projector and all the amenities provided by the host. Comfortable beds, great shower. Although the house was on the corner of an old neighborhood by a main street, it is actually pretty quiet. We only stayed for one night while dropping off our daughter to college, so we didn't get to explore down town by foot from the AirBnB location very much. We heard pitter-patter sound from the family upstairs in the morning, which is expected since there are people living upstairs, it didn't bother us at all. Thank you!

review_text: What an amazing gem in Bellingham! Safe, secure and so comfortable! This stylish flat was adorable and perfect for my stay. I was able to cook (and make coffee each day in the French press!), work-from-flat with uninterrupted WiFi and the beds were so very comfortable! The projection TV was like having our own in-house movie theater, too. And the bathroom… it is gorgeous, with a spa-like shower head! Located in an area where it’s easy to walk to shops/restaurants, this was indeed a special place. Couldn’t have asked for better communication with the hosts. Can’t wait to visit again!

We were able to walk to some of our favorite spots (Elizabeth Station and Wander Brewing) and it only look a little longer to walk downtown. We would definitely consider staying at this place again on our next trip to bham. We had a couple questions during our stay at the hosts were quick to respond. Thank you Eli & Lindsy!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: This was definitely in the top 5 of places we have stayed. Adam & Kathryn have thought of everything and the room was spotless and had all of the comforts that we needed. The finishes that they have done in the AirBnB are the best. Parking was not an issue, we had either street parking 4 steps from the front door or an assigned spot about 100 feet from the front door, the parking was great. They gave us some GREAT restaurant recommendations and we tried them all but one, only because it was raining and outside. All of the places we went to eat were within walking distance of the AirBnB and many others. It was a great location. We found a favorite coffee shop, Hammerhead Coffee, just two blocks away. This was a relaxing enjoyable time away from home which was just what we were looking for, it couldn't have been better!

name: Russell
rating_info:
Rating, 4 stars
,
·
April 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Overall, the apartment was as nice as it appeared in the picture. The kitchen was great. The spaces were well thought out, comfortable and relaxing. Every thing was very clean.
Really the only issue we had was the noise coming from the tenant above on our second night. We got back to the apartment around 1AM & music from above was loud enough to hear & there was heavy thumping like running intervals on treadmill. The noise kept up until around 3am. It was impossible to get to sleep until it finally went quiet upstairs. The loss of sleep did impact the rest of our stay.
In communication with Adam afterwards, he said: 1. First time he has had a noise issue & would check in w/the tenant; & 2. I should have felt free to call in the middle of the night to address the issue. In retrospect calling him seems reasonable but at 2am it did not.
With no prior review comments, this was likely new. So, now you know. Call if it is a recuring problem.

Knowing how much car noise my daughter's apartment has I was nervous staying here but it wasn't an issue. I hope this place is available every time my husband and I come to visit!

review_text: A very comfortable studio - nicely laid out, felt spacious for a small space. I was visiting my son who attends WWU, and I did not have a car, so I really appreciated the near-by bus line. Super easy to get to WWU and to get to the Fairhaven side of town. The downtown area was nearby, and I had both the Co-op and the Grocery Outlet close by. The sheets were extremely comfortable, the bathroom was quite roomy and Adam/Kathryn were easy to communicate with and very responsive. Excellent space!

review_text: Adam and Kathryn’s place was perfect; five stars in every way. Check in and check out were very easy. The place was meticulously clean, decorated well and thoughtfully stocked with all items needed for a very comfortable stay. The treats were a welcome surprise and greatly appreciated after a long day of travel and also appreciated having an off street parking spot. The location is perfect with restaurants, cute bakeries, and shopping all within walking distance. Definitely recommend and would stay here again in the future. Thank you very much !

review_text: Extremely well-appointed and comfortable place. We were so impressed by all of the little details - charging cords in the desk drawer, popcorn and a few drinks for movie watching, extra towels in the bathroom--I could go on. For a relatively small area, there were nicely separate areas for sitting and chatting, doing work, having a meal and, of course, sleeping. The location is very convenient for getting to restaurants and cafes and shops but surprisingly quiet for being on a corner. We will definitely stay here again as long as our son is at WWU!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Adam and Kathryn's place was fantastic. Excellent communication made finding the unit and knowing where to park our Jeep easy. The unit was super clean and had everything you needed for a week of remote work.
The bed is super comfortable, the desk great for work (including room for an extra monitor) and extra USB charging cables were there in case you needed one.
The location is fantastic as you can walk everywhere. Two blocks to three places to get coffee and the Co-op grocery store. So many great restaurants, breweries and cocktail bars are within a 5-10 min walk.
Thanks for your hospitality!
Looking forward to staying again when possible.

Easy to walk all over town, to the waterfalls at Whatcom Park, to the WWU campus (that is a bit of a workout, but ya gotta earn your beer). Bellingham is a delight and I really hope to be back. I would 100% stay here again.

They have really been thoughtful about how to be good hosts: for example, there are clear places to put suitcases, the bathroom is stocked with stuff like high quality makeup remover and real shampoo/conditioner, etc.
I will definitely stay here next time I'm in Bellingham!

Thank you, Adam and Kathryn.
Traci B.

rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I've stayed in many Airbnbs and used to co-host one myself, so I notice the little extra touches that go into a great stay. Adam and Kathryn's place hits high marks on value - walkable location, quiet and clean, clear instructions, comfortable and stylish. It had one of the few kitchens I've come across that actually had all the items I needed to make dinner. Laundry was easily accessed and much appreciated. Bed was very comfortable!
I needed a place to stay for the week while displaced from my own apartment due to plumbing problems, and was simultaneously tarting a new job, so my stress level was high but this stay made things SO much smoother. I really appreciated being able to feel at home, cozy and safe in this unit. Would highly recommend for out of town travelers needing accommodations that are easily walkable to the downtown highlights, it should meet all of your needs.

review_text: We absolutely loved our stay! The location is incredible - walkable to anything in the downtown area. There was often parking directly out front (on the street), but even when there wasn’t, there is a reserved off-street spot behind the unit. The street/traffic noise was surprisingly minimal. Excellent kitchen, very well stocked and clean. The decor was beautiful and everything was pristinely clean. The host was quick to communicate and always kind and professional. It was super easy to access the unit and check out as well. I was impressed with how thoughtful everything was - extra items in the bathroom “just in case”, extra blankets, pillows, and towels. Everything was clearly labeled, which helped a lot (especially light/fan switches)! I would absolutely stay here again next time I visit bellingham, which is relatively often!

Parking on weekend nights, if getting in later, can be difficult due to the closeness of a popular brewery. The plus is that downtown Whatcom is only a few blocks away and you'll almost never need to move your car. Cannot emphasize enough how easy it was just to walk around to wherever we wanted to go.
The space is fantastic and very inviting. Lots of cool places to check out (definitely see Henderson's bookstore if you like used bookstores). Also, checking out was breeze. Highly recommend.

review_text: This is the perfect location for a temporary home base in Bellingham. There are so many little extra things they did to make the space inviting: welcome basket of goodies, coffee station, homey decor and furniture, trail maps of local parks, Brita pitcher, available laundry, perfectly clean and modern kitchen and bathroom. And it's 2 blocks to the best groceries and a short walk to several good breweries and dozens of restaurants. I loved my 5-day stay there - it was so cozy. I could occasionally hear the upstairs neighbor, but it didn't bother me. It made me feel safer. Adam was also responsive to questions. Nothing was a surprise. Their transparency about what a downtown Bellingham location feels like helped me settle in perfectly.

-Had accessible outlets...everywhere.
-Walking distance to downtown, a wonderful yoga studio (3 OMS), coffee shops and a yummy crepe place!
-Walking distance to a Co-op, (right around the corner.)
-Has it's own parking space and ample parking right in front of the building.
-The apartment was equipped with everything I needed for my week stay, and more! They really thought of everything.
-The bed was comfortable, and so were the pillows.
-There were enough fluffy white towels!
There is also a wonderful brewery close by, and I never heard noise from it.
Lastly, communication with Adam and Kathryn was clear and prompt.
I would absolutely stay here again!

Rating, 4 stars

Stayed one night
review_text:
I traveled to Bellingham for a non-recreational, somewhat stressful purpose. What I most vividly remember, three days later, about my stay at Emma's is that I arrived stressed out and fifteen minutes later felt better. Sure, part of that was from simply getting there, but it also came from the space being welcoming, clean and authentically well-styled, for my tastes anyway. Emma really goes the extra mile with the little touches. A washer and dryer with detergent available, snacks, lots of spices and a plentiful amount of quality toiletries. Her place is exactly as her lengthy description of it portrays.
There is another unit upstairs that was occupied when I was there. Don't know if it is permanent housing, but the people there shut all the noise down by the 9 p.m. quiet curfew.
Wish I could've stayed longer to get in a good, relaxing soak with that claw-footed tub.

review_text: Check-in was very smooth and the space was very clean. We enjoyed the space and the amenities that were provided. Everything has helpful and easy to follow instructions, this made it so we didn't feel like we were doing anything incorrectly. Lastly, as just a precaution and not a complaint. If you play the piano you may want to switch the stool for one of the dining chairs. The stool is very old (which fits the aesthetic perfectly) but because of that it is very unstable. I nearly fell out of it a few times! But we had a great time and it was well worth the price. Emma was very communicative and pleasant. We would absolutely consider staying again the next time we come to Bellingham. Thank you Emma!

We stayed five nights at the Garden House, which was perfect. Emma has done a great job of making the house feel very comfortable. So many little touches that made the experience exceptional. She has a full line of natural, organic skin and body care products (oils, creams, and lotions) for you to experience. Candles and bath salts for soaking in the clawfoot tub were the cherry on top!
We appreciated her mindfulness of not using perfumed, chemical-based cleaners.
The bed was very comfortable.
The kitchen had everything we needed, and the outdoor grill was a real bonus.
The Co-op was across the street, which made getting groceries very easy. Multiple coffee spots are within a short walk.
We would stay here again for sure!

The location was excellent too - it took me less than a minute to walk over to the delicious cafe next door in the morning, and they open early so it was very convenient with the baby! I highly recommend this spot, and I'll check it out the next time I'm back in town.

name: Ariana
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
My partner and I lived in Bellingham for seven years and thought we might stop by on our way to BC. As soon as we pulled in and realized the location and saw the house, we stared at each other in disbelief. I mean it when I say it is in the actual perfect location. I could only dream of living in that spot when we lived in Bham.
We were honestly just looking for a simple place to crash, but then we fell in love the space and all of the incredible little goodies and details throughout it that it turned what was supposed to be a night out bar hopping into just dinner and a drink. All we could think about was how much better it sounded to relax in that lovely space, so that's exactly what we did. We made the short walk back home, drew a bath with some lovely soaking salts, made cocktails with the syrup mixed, put on some records, and had the most relaxing evening I have had in quite some time.
This spot restored my faith in AirBnb. It was genuinely the best part of our entire weekend.

name: Beth
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
September 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: A fantastic gem of vacation rental a stone's throw away from downtown Bellingham. It's close enough to walk to the amazing restaurants and breweries Bellingham has to offer but at the same time, feels tucked away in its own little enclave. The rental is much bigger than it appears in photos, incredibly spacious for a long weekend getaway. Emma definitely checked all the boxes with the amenities. The kitchen is incredibly well stocked with cookware and tools, not to mention the great selection of teas! The handmade soap/bath products throughout the rental are amazing, the sea salt texture spray was my favorite. Given that this is the downstairs of a duplex vacation-stay and an older home, we expected to hear more noise from the upstairs vacationers, thankfully it was very quiet. Would happily stay here again next time visiting the Bellingham area.

name: Anita
rating_info:
Rating, 3 stars
,
·
August 2022
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text:
I loved the kitchen and the tea selection and the actual house (high ceilings, big rooms, lots of light).
The place is lovely but it has a few too many quirks for the price. The shower curtains don't fully surround the shower, so the floor gets super wet every time. The kitchen-bathroom door didn't stay open without a lot of work, both bathroom doors don't close without a lot of effort, the bedroom-bathroom door doesn't have a lock. The bathroom windows didn't have curtains, which meant if you wanted an open window to let out the steam, you were looking straight into the windows of the neighbours house. The cutlery drawer in the kitchen is a bit dodgy and sticks a lot. This combined with the constant reminders about their wish for a 5 star review, the huge list of house rules and the massive number of notes/instructions around the house made me feel pressured and stressed. If it had been $100-200/night, I'd be more forgiving but this cost $345. Many of these issues could be fixed for future guests.
Also the noise from upstairs was quite loud and very early (screaming and stomping of children above us at 6am) - we were aware this could be an issue, but it still impacted the quality of our time at this Airbnb.

I would 100% stay here again and have already recommended to friends and family. If you have the opportunity, definitely stay here!!

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The place is tight bot really cozy. I love the garden. The host was so friendly that he offered fruits and vegetables from the garden. It's an old house, but have a character. The only recommendations I have is for a coffee machine, as I open my eyes early and already looking for a coffee. There is a French press,but that is no real coffee for me. The other thing is - no sink in the bathroom, so shaving for my husband was a hustle. Those are small things,but with them the place would be perfect. The location is great. It's on a quite Street, close to Starbucks, groceries, markets. The garden with bbq and chairs outside is awesome. We really enjoyed our stay there. We were lucky it didn't rain, so we spend our evenings outside. The fridge is tiny, but enough for 2 people. There are chickens separated by a fence, so much fun to watch them. The price is right. I would return. There are so many wonderful hikes in the area, it's unbelievable and we had a wonderful time at this place.

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
10/10 would absolutely recommend for couples & single travelers! There were a few things I especially appreciated:
- great check-in instructions, very easy
- nice big bathtub w/ bubble bath
- comfortable bed w/ a firm mattress and good selection of firm and soft pillows (looked like a Thuma bedframe, beautiful!)
- no artificial fragrances, natural cleaning products, soap, shampoo etc
- surprisingly well-stocked kitchen w/ a hot plate, toaster oven, sharp knife, etc - yet everything fits in the cupboard so it's not cluttered
- beautiful outdoor space that really did feel private
Obviously, this airBnB is a labor of love and has been set up with a high attention to detail that really shows. It's a great location and I highly recommend checking out Whatcom Falls if you decide to stay here!

This was a great private and small space for one or two people. I noticed the care in providing the space that was well-cleaned, provided with booklet instruction that shows the locals recommendations and history of the house. I was able to message request from Nathan for their time to receive foil for the oven stove and enjoy my small meal. The kitchenette is something I am at awed about how it was organized and well hidden inside the drawers. The blanket, and beddings to the wall of arts prints is a beautiful sight and cozy.
Throughout the experience, I was greeted by the morning to seeing the chickens and hens and the weather from rain-snow to do my exercise and come back for the night to have my full rest and watch some shows.
For that, I left a note to Nathan and Anna to thank you and leaving a review here as well.

We even share taste in household furnishings: we have the same Japanese design bed frame at our place, and a similar red and black Native American design blanket. Lots of little delights, it was therefore just what we needed during a time of stress, since we were in town for medical reasons. The hosts were balanced in respecting privacy and offering any needed support. We will be back, hopefully to have more fun.

Our baby also loved the place, she is a 13 month walking curious kiddo that explored all the corners, so we really appreciated the lack of clutter and the cleanliness of the place...important stuff when you have a baby with you! The deck was amazing, loved being there and listening to the sound of nature and admiring the trees. Lovely location!

I stayed at Terry & Kerry's place for a full week, and had an absolutely wonderful stay! Terry and Kerry are incredible hosts, who went above and beyond to welcome me and make me feel at home. Terry even made me a batch of allergen-friendly homemade cookies, because I have food allergies!
The space is quiet and peaceful, with a lovely and private view of the yard. Larrabee State Park, Whatcom Falls Park, and Mt Baker Scenic Highway were just a quick drive away.
I had no trouble working remotely during my stay, felt very safe, and enjoyed meeting Terry and Kerry's lovable dog.
I would absolutely stay at Terry and Kerry's again!

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
I had a wonderful stay at Terry and Kerry's Airbnb! From the moment I arrived, they made me feel incredibly welcome. The place was exactly as depicted in the pictures, and even more charming in person. I appreciated the thoughtful touches, such as a folder full of recommendations and fun facts, adding a personal touch to my experience. One unique feature was the opportunity to pin my location on a map, a fun way to connect with other travelers.Terry and Kerry went out of their way to ensure I had everything I needed, and the delicious cookies were a sweet surprise that I truly enjoyed. I wouldn't hesitate to stay here again, as the overall experience was fantastic.
The only minor note is that if you arrive in the dark and aren't familiar with the area, locating the road can be a bit challenging. So, I recommend approaching with caution and going slow. Additionally, I did hear the garage, but it didn't bother me since I was already awake. Overall, a lovely stay with gracious hosts!

review_text: I HIGHLY recommend staying at Terry’s place in Bellingham! Terry and her husband were such friendly, cool and welcoming hosts with such fascinating lives that you just want to be friends after meeting them! They have a beautiful home and garden that’s extremely peaceful and private. We were greeted with flowers and greenery that was serene. The ‘Aloha’ suite itself reminded us of our stay in Hawai’i and we truly felt like we were on vacation while staying there. Everything was clean, with amenities in the unit clearly labeled and well appointed. There were delicious fresh baked oatmeal cookies for us when we arrived. Terry provided us with helpful advice for our hike in the area and lended us some micro spikes for our shoes in case there was snow on the trail. We only wished we had more time to spend at Terry’s home as our time there was limited with a busy hiking itinerary and hope we can return again soon! It was a far better experience than staying in a hotel.

The furniture was a bit small for a tall person and the kitchenette area was limited, so I wouldn’t expect to be able to make any meals in this unit (only an issue if you make some of your own meals while traveling). Overall we enjoyed our stay and it was a good value.

review_text: Having never been to Bellingham, we seemed to have chosen the right place for us! This house is close to many of the areas we visited in our 4 days. On the way, we drove on Chuckanut Drive. The next day we went to Birch Bay area. The following day, we went to the Fairhaven District in Bellingham and visited the many parks and lakes in the area and not far from this Airbnb. The hosts were excellent and offered ideas on where to visit and have a meal. The room is filled with many brochures and maps to guide you as well. We found the room and space just right for our needs and used the outdoor BBQ for our meals. If we are ever in the area, we would not hesitate to rebook this place. Thanks for all the treats too!

The garden view from the windows is enchanting. The evening light and sounds of birds chirping enticed us to take a stroll down the road to explore.
I highly recommend booking this suite! Terry was a fantastic host, giving us great directions and warning us about some construction on the way.

,

Stayed over a week
review_text: Terry and Kerry are really wonderful hosts and lovely people. They had me over for dinner one evening, and were always offering to help or pick something up in town if I needed. The space was very comfortable - everything was clean, extremely well-stocked for a small space, and Terry provided me a small work desk (since I was staying for a month while working remotely) and a portable AC unit during a brief heat wave. The bed was very comfortable, the shower had great water pressure, and the wifi held up nicely for my full-time work schedule (late in my stay it had a few hiccups, but still functioned and the hosts got the provider to come and address the issues promptly, and I was able to use my phone as a hot-spot to fill any gaps). Even though the kitchen is small, I was still able to get creative and prepare almost all my meals at home. The neighborhood is beautiful and has a couple nice walking routes, with many gorgeous hikes a short drive away. I'd definitely stay here again.

It’s so well organized and immediately feels like home. There are many small thoughtful touches that make you feel like a cared for guest.
Terry herself is so kind and thoughtful. She’s more than accommodating and has clearly put a lot of thought and effort into how to run her AirBnB for her guests.
We’ll be back!

We woke up the next morning to atleast a foot of snow (maybe more) covered my entire car and then some… If it weren’t for Terry and her very helpful and handy husband, my car would have never gotten out of there and with the snow storm we had for several days on end, who knows how I would have gotten my car out.
It was very cold and slippery out but that did not stop them from being knee deep in the snow, shoveling snow out from under my car and even pushing it by hand.
I truly appreciate and am really grateful. I would highly recommend and definitely see myself staying again.

Our recent stay at this Airbnb was great. The place is centrally located in Bellingham with easy driving distances to most areas of Bellingham. While the house is on a fairly busy road and adjacent to I-5, the road noise was not bad and the house is located in a nice neighbourhood with close access to a walking trail.
The hosts were incredibly welcoming and made us feel right at home. Communication was prompt and clear, from the initial booking to any questions I had during my stay.
The house itself was tastefully decorated and clean. The attention to detail was evident in every corner, from the cozy living space to the well-equipped kitchen.
Overall, my stay fully met expectations, and I would highly recommend it to others.

Stayed with a pet
review_text: It served us well in visiting our son at WWU - easy for him to come there. Easy to have a dog there - yard felt secure and fenced, as long as you don't have a jumper. Alabama St. can be busy. I was happy that I bought a cookie tray with me, but the rest of the kitchen set-up was fine. The "log" heater was nice, made for good atmosphere, and warmth. The trundle bed was loudly squeaky for having all the beds in one room, but comfortable enough. We had 5 people sharing dinner and playing games, and we did not feel squashed. We did not ride the bikes (wheels needed some air and it was rainy), but they were a very nice amenity. There is a nearby walking path that we used with our dog. The check-in and check-out was easy. Did not need the owners but felt that they would have been responsive if I did. I definitely would stay here again.

review_text: This Airbnb was conveniently located and my dogs and I had easy access to hikes nearby. The yard was great for them as well although the fence is very low and the house is on a busy street and the neighbor's dog does do some fence fighting - nothing major, just something to be aware when traveling with dogs. I loved the couch! Very Comfy. The bed wasn't great for my back b/c too soft but might be wonderful for others. My only issue was that the oven was full of oil or drippings and the entire place got smoked out when I tried to use it. This also was on top, on the stove. I had to spend some time cleaning that. Host's manager did offer to come and clean it but once I live somewhere [I stayed for a month], I prefer my privacy and wished it was properly cleaned before arrival. It's overall described accurately and the manager was super responsive. Neighbors are super nice and helpful.

This home is fantastic. We have stayed here twice now, to drop our daughter off at WWU. It is a quick and easy 8 minute drive to the south campus. Being close to Trader Joes was a bonus, too.
I also used one of the bikes this time and LOVED it! I took it up to the railroad trail at the top of the street, and biked every morning. One of the mornings I biked to Whatcom park and saw the waterfalls. That place is gorgeous. You shouldn't miss it.
Communication was quick and easy, and the host was very accommodating. Don't hesitate - rent this place. You won't be sorry.

,

Stayed with a pet
review_text:
This cozy little spot was great for dropping our oldest off to college at Western. There’s a sleeping area with 3 beds, a full galley kitchen, and a separate living & dining area with a large, comfy couch. A simple space with all the essentials. All clean, fresh, and well kept.
The kitchen equipment includes dishes, coffee maker/ electric tea kettle, very basic pots & pans, salt & pepper. It’s very light on extras, so BYO for spices, vinegar, oil and the like.
We were there during the week of snow and very cold temps that ended with a windstorm. I was so pleasantly surprised by how toasty warm and comfortable this little cottage was, complete with a gas-fireplace —cute pot belly stove style.
What a welcome refuge from the wintery weather!
PS—loved all the pet friendly touches, although we ended up leaving our dog behind at the last minute. The dog-friendly front entrance/mud room is a super sweet touch.

The couch was super comfy and the TV subscriptions allowed me time to catch up on all my trashy reality TV shows.

review_text: Our stay at this house was perfect! It’s a cute little house. There is a smaller bed with a rollaway bed underneath it and a bigger bed. They are both in the same room. A perfect size for my husband and my daughter, myself and our dog. It was super clean when we checked in and had really nice new carpet! There is a fire place to keep everything warm and toasty. The location can’t be beat! It is in a residential neighborhood and pretty quiet. But it is a five minute drive to most places, maybe 10 minutes to Fairhaven. We were able to go hiking in the mornings and go to great restaurants and shopping in the afternoon. There’s a couple nights that we stayed in and made dinner. They left candy for a movie night. So my daughter give this house five stars! The Internet was fast and we were able to stream movies. All in all… A Perfect little getaway. Thank you to Sara and Ian for being such wonderful hosts! We will be back!

review_text:
This place was terrific. We were visiting to see Western Washington University, which is a short drive away. While we were in the house, we cooked several meals, which was very easy to do, because Trader Joes was about a block away! Also, a great burger place, delicious Thai food and bubble tea joint! Yay!
The bed was really comfy and my daughter wanted some privacy, so she slept on the couch, which she said was as comfortable as a bed.
Communications were smooth and easy. Check in was no problem at all. I just used a lockbox with a key.
She provided two bikes, but we were enjoying ourselves in the house so much, we never even got out on the bikes! I did go for several walk, however, on the FABULOUS path about three blocks up from the house. So nice. And in September - I picked buckets of blackberries and made cobbler. Yum!
Oh - and we brought our dog. She loved the fenced in back yard. She sniffed around happily. The house was very welcoming and comfortable for the dog. She is an old lady (12 years old) so she needs to be comfortable.

When selecting a property in the Bellingham area, the view and proximity to water was my priority.
This property delivered – you could go down to the water or take advantage of multiple decks and the view - fabulous!
The kitchen was also stocked with EVERYTHING you could possibly need.
The bedding was soft, radiant heat was comfortable, and everything was spotless.
Carol does note the train in the listing, which at first, gave me pause. But, I am glad I chose this listing. The view, the neighborhood, the home and the host make this an excellent choice.
I hope to be back and stay for two weeks next time!

review_text: I cannot say enough about this location, honestly. The space itself is brilliantly perched above the Salish Sea, looking out to Chuckanut and Lummi Islands. There is an abundance of seating on the large deck to enjoy the seals, birds and boats. Inside, the floor to ceiling windows really serve to bring the outside in. The degree of quality that this home offers is second to none. Sonos sound linked to our phone and played music in every room via the built in speaker system. The furniture is top notch, the bed is incredibly comfortable, and the view to wake up to provided the absolute best way to start the day! Well, the provided Nespresso and pastries were pretty great too! Communication was outstanding check in was a breeze. What an absolutely fantastic location! We shall return!

I cannot wait to get back to the Crows Nest and I cannot recommend this location to enough people!

Carol was an amazing hostess and it was a pleasure to spend a bit of time with her when we arrived. It was great to hear how her property had evolved during her time there. She has truly done an amazing job creating an oasis near town. The house is done with tasteful, comfortable furnishings and every amenity you could want. Little touches like eggs, milk and pastries left for us - to comfortable blankets to take out and snuggle up on the deck and watch the sunset were everywhere!
The trains do go by (but that is unavoidable if you want to be in this area of Chuckanut or Bellingham.) The house did not shake or anything as the trains went by- but you can hear them and should look elsewhere if that would be an issue for you. We had no issues with it whatsoever!
We didn't want to leave the property! We didn't go to dinner or even really shop- we just sat on the deck and watched boats go by! Great for our spirits but not our to-do list! Thank you Carol!

review_text: We had an amazing stay at Crow's Nest! The pictures do not do it justice. The view is awesome, the layout is spacious, the amenities are on-point, and Carol is the best! From the friendly welcome, to the history of the home, to the special touches, every bit of our stay was great. The place was very clean, the kitchen had everything we needed and more, and the bathrooms were clean and included complimentary toiletries. The outdoor area was peaceful and beautifully manicured. We spent a lot of time on the deck, enjoying the beautiful view, watching the birds, and listening to the waves. There are several seating areas as you make your way down to the water level and the grounds along the way are beautiful. We had a day where the tide was out pretty far and we were able to explore; we even saw a deer walking along the beach. Getting to Fairhaven, outdoor activities, and restaurants is easy. We are already planning our return trip!!

This was our second glorious visit to Carol's beautiful home on Chuckanut Bay. We loved every minute of it! We actually went to heal from a Celebration of Life after the passing of my sister and her husband. It was the perfect place to be...absolutely stunning view of the bay, beautiful comfortable home, peaceful music in every room, beautiful gardens everywhere, and wonderful Carol! Her special touches are everywhere & the best we have ever stayed in! She is so gracious and ready to help in any possible way. She encouraged us to take a Birding Cruise from Bellingham, which was a highlight of our trip, as we were able to photography Tufted Puffins! WOW!! We love nature and birds, and were so comforted by all the birds and wildlife we could see and hear from the patio.
It was hard for us to leave this lovely peaceful space. But, we know that we will be back in the future!! I can't recommend this wonderful place enough! Thank you Carol and Logan for sharing such a beautiful space!!

rating_info:

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text: The biggest (and only) problem with this location is you will never want to leave! The Crow’s Nest was “over the top” amazing! It exceeded our expectations and the pictures don’t do it justice; it’s much better, if that’s even possible to imagine. We could have spent our entire time there at the house and been extremely happy without ever venturing out into the cute surrounding area, although we enjoyed that as well. We highly recommend Oyster Bar(Bow) and Black Cat (Fairhaven) restaurants. The eagles, sea otters, seals, blue herons and much more kept us thoroughly entertained. Carol is truly the hostess with the mostess. Her flowers and succulents everywhere (inside and out) are gorgeous and her green thumb is impressive. The pastries were delicious too! The shower and plush linens helped us feel even more pampered. Very clean and comfortable. Carol thought of everything! We hope to return on our next trip to the PNW!

name: Shay
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,

,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: This modern, architecturally stunning northwest home with panoramic views of Chuckanut Bay offered me a tranquil, comforting and restorative retreat. While the beautiful interior, filled with all the thoughtful touches to create a welcoming and luxurious space and a wall of windows to bring the outside into the home, I spent much of my visit on the expansive deck, taking in the bird songs and the sound of lapping water and the warmth of the Solstice sun. I took one of the host’s kayaks out for both an early evening and early morning paddle and saw curious seals and lots of shorebirds. Carol provided a lovely touch of delicious breakfast items in a well-stocked kitchen, a list of recommended restaurants in nearby Fairhaven and Bellingham, and ideas on numerous hikes within 10 minutes of the home. She was a delight to chat with and responsive to any questions. It was hard to leave such a peaceful and natural space by the water’s edge.

name: Laurie
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
June 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: My husband and I spent a lovely week in the Crow’s Nest and were sad to leave this magical place. We savored spending mornings and evenings on the deck, soaking up the magnificent view. We took a day to drive up Mt. Baker Highway to Picture Lake with a spectacular view of Mt. Shuksan. Another day we took the ferry from Anacortes to San Juan island to explore Roche Harbor and Lime Kiln State Park. We also spent a day in the delightful Whatcom Falls and Boundary Bay parks, both of which had lovely trails. Without a doubt, Carol’s place lives up to all the praise you’ve read. Hesitate no further and book it.

The peaceful atmosphere here surrounded by trees and overlooking the spectacular bay was incredible. We could have sat on the enormous deck for 72 hours straight and been perfectly happy. The interior of the house is spacious and luxurious. Carol has thought of so many little details like cream for the coffee, delicious pastries for breakfast, and convenient bathroom amenities. The bed and linens were fantastic and the whole house sound system made it feel like we were living in a spa in the clouds. We will miss the nightly sunsets and hope to be back again sometime!

review_text: This was our 2nd stay at the gorgeous Crow’s Nest — and we already can’t wait to return! Carol is a dream — she is such a gracious, friendly host. The house itself is luxurious, yet still comfortable…you will want for nothing, and will be presented with the best view you can imagine. We had jaw dropping sunsets every single night — had to pry ourselves away from this jewel of a house. When you do finally tear yourself away…take advantage of Carol and her son’s recommendations for restaurants — they’re fantastic. Thai Maison was a happy surprise. Also don’t miss Taylor Shellfish Farm — grilled oysters are out of this world. Carol is also happy to share hiking recommendations, which we happily took advantage of, and there are kayaks at the house to explore the bay that is literally just steps away. Absolute perfection!

Water access is down 70 stairs so not for anyone with limited mobility. The view and being right on the water made up for this for us.
Really the only downside is the train traffic; more than we realized and not a romantic train sound in the distance; rather what it is, a freight train. Thankfully, we were able to sleep through the sound after the first night. Overall, an amazing stay.

review_text: Even after reading all the incredible reviews, the house exceeded our already high expectations. Picture/words can’t capture the view and the positive energy throughout. Angie met us and was very friendly and provided a great introduction to all the impressive features of the house. The home was clean, comfortable and relaxing with every kitchen amenity you could think of. There were even pastries and orange juice and a board with restaurant recommendations.  With the windows open you can hear the peaceful rhythm of the waves. And the heated floors, gas fireplace and in-home sound system make it quite cozy. We even found the trains going by a fun and enjoyable addition. There is a deck with several seating options and stairs to the water’s edge that light up at night. There are many restaurants nearby in Fairhaven and Bellingham. The Crow’s Nest is definitely one of the nicest places we’ve ever stayed.  We’re looking forward to coming back soon!

review_text: Absolute stunning perfection! Carol is so charming and helpful and her home is an absolute dream. Hiking, exploring the coastline, wandering/shopping around Fairhaven/Bellingham, finding awesome eateries/breweries/coffee shops, and just relaxing in this gorgeous home are some of the highlights of our stay here. On day 2 of 5, we booked a another stay — which should be indicative of how much we loved our time at the Crow’s Nest!! The view is next level amazing, and the home itself is gorgeous, but still exuding a comfortable spa-like vibe. The kitchen is perfectly stocked — we cooked a fantastic dinner with seafood we got from Taylor Shellfish Farm (a can’t miss if you’re an oyster fan!) and we weren’t lacking for anything. Although we did get distracted more than a few times by one of the best sunsets ever, over the endless, mesmerizing bay view! There are thoughtful touches throughout — cozy blankets, delicious smelling soaps and lotions, a spacious closet and laundry area, beautiful fireplace, multiple comfortable reading nooks, interesting subject matter coffee table books, slippers, robes, beautiful plants…the list goes on and on! Oh, and the radiant heat and Sonos whole house sounds system…we enjoyed those immensely. There is nothing about this lovely home that we would change. What a dream!

Everything one possibly needs during a stay, you can find it in the house. Also they have fast internet which is a huge plus. The host Carol lives next door, she is super welcoming and responsive. The location is great. Checkout process is super easy and I don’t have to do 10 chores to clean the house. The whole experience was luxurious and relaxing. I cannot wait to come back and stay longer next time. p.s. yes there is train rail next to the house. And yes it does run all day and night (once every couple hours). The house is so good that the train sounds doesn’t bother me one bit.

name: Kimberly

Rating, 5 stars

,

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
The Crow’s Nest is one of the most spectacular places to stay in the PNW! The host, Carol, lives next door and is the quintessential hostess. We were greeted by Carol and given door codes and the general rundown. We had eggs, cream for coffee, butter and orange juice in the refrigerator and ice in the freezer for our use and fresh pastries on the counter! Carol gave us tips and suggestions on what we could do and they also have kayaks you can use to go and see the baby seals!!! Yes, baby seals. ❤️
The view is on another level and showcases Chuckanut Bay in all its glory. Sit on the deck overlooking the water with a drink, sit under the Madrona tree on the chairs with evening drinks…just all the drinks!! 🤣 I guess you could also read. 😂
Every now and then, you hear the train, but it is not anything that would ruin your day or anything. Just a train. 😁
There are two main living areas, just the perfect amount of room to sprawl out and get comfy. I mean, then there’s the deck!!! Have all your meals, read, take a nap, do all the things out on that beautiful deck!!
The Crows Nest is perfect for couples looking for a getaway that is beautiful and serene with the BEST hostess!! If it’s available, book it NOW!!

name: Gayle
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars

July 2022
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: Sometimes words are inadequate and this is one of those times. I selected Carol’s home for our anniversary celebration. Pictures were so inviting, but when we walked through the door the view was simply stunning - her home is beautifully designed and so wonderfully equipped - and all the small thoughtful touches just go to prove that Carol has found her second calling. She is a fabulous host. My husband and I kept saying - “we could live here” - so obviously Carol has created a space that feels like “home” only better! We felt spoiled! We felt relaxed. And we knew if we needed anything at all, Carol was just a quick message away. It was the perfect combination. We look forward to the day that we may return. Thank you, Carol, for providing this sanctuary for us. It was a memorable way to celebrate 19 years. Sending gratitude hugs, Gayle and John.

name: John
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
July 2022
,
·
Stayed over a week
review_text:
As one can find by looking back through the over 440 reviews for this truly uniquely beautiful home and location on the Chuckanut Bay in the Pacific North West we have been frequent visitors and guest of this amazing property and even more amazing host who clearly is the quintessential super host of Airbnb properties. I once again find myself searching for the most appropriate and fitting combination of superlatives and adjectives to describe the Crow’s Nest property, the Bellingham region of Washington and Carol, who hosts this property. As I have commented in the past, as have so many other of Carol’s guests, the Crow’s Nest is in every way a uniquely beautiful home and location on the Chuckanut Bay where the Northern Cascades virtually come down to the ocean. In fact the main highway leading to the property from the south (Highway 11) is listed among the most beautiful drives in Washington State as picked by local experts and one can experience other drives on this list within a days drive from the property.
The home is of contemporary, northwestern architecture and has been designed to take maximum advantage of the stunning views. One never tires of utilizing the full length outdoor deck and wall of floor to ceiling windows, that run the full extent of the home which views the bay, as the skies, water and sunsets offer stunning vistas that are sure to delight even the most discerning individual making it hard to leave for a day of adventure. The deck is furnished with a variety of chairs and tables well suited to most anyone’s comfort. As one can see from the posted photos the spacious home is an open architecture with vaulted ceiling. The host keeps the home meticulously clean and most welcoming. The home is fully stocked with the highest of quality of virtually everything including everything you will need to make you stay comfortable, and memorable. A modern and fully functional kitchen, extremely comfortable Ekornes furniture throughout the great room, a comfortable queen sized bed, two full baths and a laundry room all on the same level. The home includes a gas fireplace, in floor heating, a whole home Sonos sound system, attractive artwork, ceiling fans, full length sunscreen shades on all the windows and so much more. The home and location offer both a sense of peaceful privacy and the ambience of being isolated from the urban environment. Bellingham is but a few miles away and has everything and anything one will need for entertainment, excellent grocery stores, dining options including waterfront restaurants, local farm produce and opportunities for virtually any outdoor activities. Mount Baker highway into the Cascades offers some of the most spectacular views one will find in the lower 48. As Mount Baker gets the most snowfall in the winter of any other location in the world (annual average of some 63 feet, and a record of over 90 feet in a single year). A must see if you are staying long enough to spend a day trip to this area.
To make your stay even more special and as I have noted in the past, Carol’s hospitality is truly extraordinary. She is gracious, warm and a welcoming host and in my opinion is the gold standard for all others to attempt to equal. Her combination of design and accessorizing skills coupled with her attention to every detail including small touches make the home truly beautiful to enjoy with every room having just the right furnishings, accessories, plants and amenities. She evidences a focus and passion for making your visit her priority while never interfering with your activities she is always available for any and all of your questions or needs. As Carol has spent her entire life in this area she is a tremendous resource for suggestions on virtually and all of your interests with outstanding suggestions and personal experiences to make your time here even that much more memorable.
For anyone with the opportunity to stay in this fabulous home, it will amaze and delight!
While thank you Carol cannot come close to expressing our appreciation for you sharing this exquisite home, remarkably gorgeous location, your most gracious support of every need, your generosity and your countless little extra touches; thank you once again Carol for yet another amazing, most memorable and enjoyable experience.

review_text: The most incredible airbnb bar none. We have stayed at airbnbs all around the globe and this was by far our favorite. Carol has thought of every detail: a fully stocked kitchen, spa-like bath items, luxury linens and the list goes on and on. She greeted us apon our arrival, went over the workings of the house (TV, SONOS sound system), provided great local recommendations for dining, sightseeing and hiking and left us with some goodies for the morning (eggs, cream, butter and delicious pastries). BUT nothing will prepare you for the house and its location...the pictures truly do not do it justice. The home itself is gorgeous with its clean, modern, but also warm norwegian influences - and then you see the view...be still my heart... it is stunning!!! I must have 45 pictures from the deck from sunny mornings, rainy afternoons to breathtaking sunsets. 5 stars just isnt enough for this one. Only cons we could come up with are the train (not a big deal at all) and no blinds in the bedroom (moon can be bright at night if you are a light sleeper and like the dark). But trust me in that you will not be disappointed with this rental! Thx again Carol for a truly amazing stay in your home...

review_text: First impression on arriving--surprise--on the location, waterfront with spectacular views of Chuckanut Bay, and the size of the property, largest 1 BR I've experienced. Second impression, delight--the Crow's Nest is beautifully designed with luxe comfort in mind. Every detail is worked through, and every need considered. The radiant heat in the floors is a comforting touch as are the built in sound system, the spa robes and slippers, and the throws in little niches. I loved the lighting throughout and all of the sky lights. It's hard to pick a favorite element, maybe the live orchids, athuriums, and succulents in perfect places. Carol is an excellent host and provides information that you need while in the home as well as recommendations. She mentioned the Tulip Festival, and we went--loved it! We'll be back!

If you have found this review, then you have already found the best place that Airbnb has to offer. To begin with, Carol is the perfect hostess for the property. The communication was timely and initial walk through was complete enough to understand the house and how everything works, and we were then left to enjoy it. That was not hard to do.
The view of the water could make you think you were in the only house on the bay. The neighborhood is quiet, ( apart from the contributions from Burlington Northern - though that was fine by us ). If you are adept at cooking it's a cook's kitchen. Stocked well beyond expectation for utensils and cooktops, oil, balsamic vinegar and spices. We normally bring a Henckels along, but there is no need, it's all there. If you don't cook, the restaurant recommendations are all completely right. Carol has clearly thought through what her guests could need to be comfortable during their stay.

Between the radiant heating (warm floors), slippers, soft throws, fireplace, and double-headed shower, it had the feeling of a spa retreat. There were so many enjoyable and luxe details to delight in, including the thoughtful pastries Carol set out for us and some lovely provisions in the fridge. Music is our thing, so we loved the Sonos sound system throughout. This place is a gem and we look forward to future stays!

review_text:
This treehouse is truly remarkable. I can safely say I’ve never been in an Airbnb quite like this! Natasha and Brandon have done an incredible job putting so many finishing touches and details into the treehouse, and their attention to detail truly shows. The place was absolutely spotless, too. Such a cool experience!!
There were a couple of minor things - as others have said, the bed is not very comfortable, even with a mattress topper. It’s quite squeaky, so if anyone rolls over, it may wake light sleepers. We spoke with the hosts about the noise from the heaters, and about needing to replace the pans in the kitchen - I would say, don’t plan on cooking any large meals, as the kitchen is very efficient.
The road noise is noticeable on the deck, and if you open any of the windows. It detracts a bit from the peaceful setting, but the views are excellent and the treehouse is still gorgeous.
Overall, a really lovely stay!

review_text: Natasha and Brandon's tree house was clean, well stocked, and private. It's a small space but they made so much out of the space with tables, counters, etc. that can extend as needed but also be compact as needed. Communication was excellent - prompt, friendly, welcoming. You can hear some of the highway traffic but it is exactly as described - you hear it outside but with windows and doors closed, it's silent. The one thing that would have made our stay more comfortable would have been a more comfortable pull-out couch with a thicker mattress but the extra foam padding they provide made it better. Love the large projector and all the movies made available to guests!

name: Trinity
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
March 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text: I have nothing but great things to say about this stay and the hosts! The treehouse was immaculately clean, they added sweet touches like fresh flowers, they left us a basket of locally made treats, they had a whole book of information and instructions about the treehouse and nearby town. You truly feel like you’re in a fairytale while staying there, the waterfall is magical, and being literally in the trees was so beautiful. The kitchen and bathroom are great for the space and the projector screen makes for great cozy evenings if you’re not enjoying the deck with fire pit or hot tub. I had questions before booking about accessibility and Natasha was so kind and helpful with everything. The only thing we were sad about was not getting to meet their cat ‘Dude’ that comes around. It was truly one of the best trips my mom and I have ever taken. We have recommended it to all our friends and family and will absolutely be coming back to enjoy this incredible place!

name: Elianna
rating_info:

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our stay at Natasha and Brandon's treehouse was like stepping into a fairy tale, truly every inner child’s dream come true! From the minute we rolled up, they greeted us and offered EV parking, making us feel right at home, they really went above and beyond to make sure we had the best time and felt at ease.
The treehouse itself, tucked away in the forest, was the ultimate getaway spot away from all the city noise. The views, sounds of the waterfall, and birds singing were like something straight out of a movie. It had that perfect mix of adventure vibes and modern comfort.
One of the highlights of our trip was the fantastic recommendations provided. Natasha had an extensive knowledge of the local area and offered personalized recommendations for places to explore. From the stunning views and beautiful accommodations to the incredible hospitality and thoughtful recommendations, every aspect of our experience was nothing short of perfect. We cannot recommend this property enough!

We will be coming back for another special occasion and have already recommended this place to all of our friends.

review_text: Our stay at the Bellingham Treehouse, hosted by Natasha and Brandon, was magical. Despite cold weather, the cozy and luxurious treehouse made up for it, offering stunning 360 views and serenity from our treetop retreat. We couldn't use the hot tub due to a chlorine allergy. However, we enjoyed the home theater and the many thoughtful touches like a delightful tea selection and local snacks. The interior's warmth, elegant design, and natural setting provided a unique and comfortable experience. Natasha and Brandon's commitment to guest comfort made our brief stay memorable. The Bellingham Treehouse is ideal for a peaceful and luxurious escape into nature. Thanks to our hosts for such an inspiring and tranquil stay.

Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A beautiful treehouse and location, you can tell Natasha and Brandon care about this place and their guests. However, we had two issues others should be aware of. While there is a 4k projector, the internet service is not good enough for it to be useful. We were unable to stream at a quality above 240p because of the poor internet. The pullout bed is also very uncomfortable and needs replaced. I'm sure it was great when new, but we actually left before the end of our visit because we didn't went to spend another night on that bed and without being able to use the projector. Our plan to watch the Superbowl here didn't work out as we hoped.
Otherwise we really loved the space and location, but the price point makes those two issues tough to swallow. This spot is a 5/5 at a lower price, but unfortunately we didn't have the experience the listed amenities and price would suggest. But if your priorities are otherwise, the location and treehouse experience are great.

review_text: This place is incredible. What a unique experience. The setting is gorgeous with the waterfall and forest. It rained much of the time but it didn’t detract from the experience. We even sat on the deck and had a fire in the gas fire pit table and enjoyed eating dinner out there while it rained. The pictures don’t do it justice. It’s a little scary how the treehouse is situated but it was crafted extremely well and so I felt very safe. We had a great time and although we went out and explored the surrounding Bellingham area as well, we really didn’t want to leave the treehouse. The hottub was in great condition. If you’re going to stay here, keep in mind that it’s a treehouse and small compared to a house, but it was still very nice and comfortable for two people. I highly recommend staying here for a romantic weekend getaway.

The only thing to note is that if it is a bit windy, you definitely hear knocking on the treehouse. The first night was windier than the first and it did keep me up. I was able to turn on the fan to block it out a bit. By the second night either I didn’t notice it as much or I was used to it at that point. But I am also a light sleeper so that could’ve been it too.
Other than that the treehouse was absolute perfection, and we plan to return for another visit sometime!

My wife and I had a very memorable anniversary weekend here and would recommend it to anyone wishing a private, peaceful stay surrounded by nature.

,

Stayed one night
review_text: This place was beautiful 😍. Very peaceful and serene. I would sit out on the porch all day, if I could, and listen to the water trickling down the rocks. You do hear the giant Douglas fir trees lightly "thumping" that are attached to the treehouse but I thought this was neat as you don't realize that trees do make sounds. This was a cute and quaint little place. Perfect for 1 or 2 people. I would suggest taking a smaller bag that you can carry over your shoulder with all of your belongings as there is a short wood chip path that you have to walk down to. Doesn't work well with luggage on wheels ☺️. Overall, this place was definitely worth it and such a neat experience. It had everything we needed and Natasha was a great host. She recommended several places to eat. We ate at the Black Cat for dinner (great choice) and also the Birch Door Cafe for breakfast (even better). She was available if we needed anything, otherwise, we just enjoyed the peace and quiet. Would highly recommend.

review_text:
I surprised my girlfriend with an overnight stay at the Bellingham treehouse, and it did not disappoint! The place is so well built and decorated. Whoever built it took serious pride in their work, and it shows! The waterfall and surrounding hills are breathtaking. The living space was sheik and cozy. The entertainment center was so much fun, with the projector movie screen. It was also really easy to play music. I would highly recommend this place to anyone!
Also, my girlfriend LOVED it.

name: Andrew
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed one night
review_text: The treehouse was amazing. Great views and the hot tub was nice as well. There were well written instructions for everything. If you plan to go into town, I suggest loading up your navigation while connected to Wi-Fi at the treehouse. Cell reception was spotty until you get well out to the main road. The pullout bed was a nice quality one but keep in mind it is still a pullout. Even with the mattress topper, we found it a bit hard. If the weather is nice, I suggest keeping the window cracked at night and you can fall asleep to the sounds of the waterfall. Overall we would definitely stay again.

name: Carly
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
May 2023
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
A dendrophile's paradise. I can't say enough about how impeccably aesthetic this luxury treehouse is, and how the place and its surroundings make it incredibly easy to relax.
First, the drive leading up to the treehouse is very enjoyable. Shortly after you turn onto the main drive, you'll be able to see the treehouse nestled high above on your right, and you will know you are in for a big treat.
The instructions to find the place were extremely accurate and easy to follow which made check in as stress-free as possible.
The view is stunning, the bed and linens are as comfy as a cloud, the surround-sound is a dream, the tasteful decorations are delightful, and the thoughtful touches (like local breakfast cookies and granola) make this one a cut above the rest.
P.S. Try the nearby logging trail for a quiet and enchanting walk through the forest.

review_text:
My husband found this treehouse as a birthday weekend getaway for me. It was perfect! Natasha accommodated an early check-in for us as we drove up from Seattle and wanted to maximize our time in the treehouse while there was still daylight. The waterfall is literally right next to/below the treehouse and it's so peaceful to listen to. It's a cozy space but did not feel cramped-- the sofa bed was a bit firm but fine for one night. The hot tub was an amazing perk -- and there are bathrobes and sandals for guests to use! They really thought of everything. The 4K projector with Netflix/AppleTV/etc was perfect to watch a movie at the end of our night.
Highly recommend for a relaxing and romantic getaway!
It's about 15 min driving to downtown Bellingham and we enjoyed a great dinner at Carnal.

review_text: My wife and I had the most amazing stay at the treehouse! Every morning we experienced a stunning view and serene waterfall right below the balcony. It's very secluded but close enough to town for a nice dinner, shopping, or a walk on the pier next to Bellingham Bay. Just over a 45 minute drive away from Canada, the treehouse offers everything one could ask for a romantic weekend or a family trip to see some of the most stunning views and hikes that Washington has to offer. The host was always available if we had any questions or needed recommendations. Prepare for a drive up a rugged road before a quiet, 5-star stay. You will not regret staying here!

review_text: What an outstanding place to visit and stay! There are really no words to fully interpret the experience. The tree house is sitting above a scenic valley, surrounded by luscious Washington forest. The waterfall right beside the tree house is rushing down, what seems to be, a couple of hundred yards drop - absolutely stunning. The scenery is simply impeccable! The house itself is very sound, built and decorated with a good taste and piece of mind. It has a 180° view of panoramic windows, plus smaller windows on pretty much every wall that allows you to enjoy the gorgeous nature surrounding you. It is a studio setup, so your living room is your bedroom as well (pull out sofa is really comfortable). Waking up to those captivating views was simply priceless. We would definitely recommend for romantic couple getaway. Hosts are very attentive, helpful, and happily available with any questions. Honestly, if we could, we would give it a 10☆ out of 5! We are planning to revisit this house again in the future.

name: Mark
rating_info:
Rating, 5 stars
,
·
January 2024
,
·
Stayed a few nights
review_text:
Our most recent stay at Annie's place was during an "Arctic Blast" that hit Bellingham during mid-January. The daytime temps were around 20 degrees Fahrenheit, and the nighttime temps were in the single digits. One night in particular, powerful gusts drove the wind chill down to subzero levels. In short, it was VERY cold outside.
We were perfectly warm and comfortable inside Annie's "Raven's City Roost" throughout this period of extreme cold. The unit is very well insulated, and the heater gives off plenty of warmth. Don't hesitate to book a stay there regardless of the season; you will always be comfortable.
The unit is located off of what must be the quietest alley on planet earth. If cleanliness, peacefulness, and comfort are what you value most in an Airbnb rental, look no further--this is the place for you. And Annie is a friendly and wonderful host.

Neighborhood has cafes, restaurants, grocery store, etc. making it easy without a car. Even with two busier streets nearby, the apartment was quiet, private, safe and cozy.
Annie was a great host. Quick to respond to any question or concern, I had complete peace of mind while my family visited. The space was spotless, bright, warm and comfortable. Kitchen was well equipped for someone who likes to cook. Comfortable bed, good hot water, easy laundry. Lots of little extras like snacks and flowers. One of the best Airbnb stays I’ve ever had. It was also the absolute coziest landing pad at the end of the night, loaded with all the creature comforts we could possibly need. The very best part was the wildly comfortable bed with the softest sheets. We didn’t have a car with us and the bus to downtown station was right across the street, which made getting around super easy when we weren’t walking (which is totally possible, especially in warmer weather). Highly recommend, especially for a couple – it really feels like your own little nest up above the neighborhood.

February 2023
,
·
Stayed about a week
review_text: I had a terrific 7-night stay at Annie's studio apartment, nicknamed "Raven's City Roost". The apartment served as a base from which I explored multiple Bellingham neighborhoods and nearby communities for future planned relocation to the area. The apartment is located on the edge of the Columbia and Lettered Streets neighborhoods, and downtown Bellingham is a short walk away--about 20 minutes for a brisk walker. The apartment is spotlessly clean, private, cozy and peaceful. The bed is comfortable, and I slept very well each night during my stay. I walked between 6 to 10 miles a day, night and day, all over Bellingham and never felt unsafe. The small kitchen and downstairs laundry room are great conveniences. One of the best parts of my trip, however, was meeting Annie in person for an enjoyable chat. She's a fantastic hostess, and cares a great deal about her guests' comfort and satisfaction. It's hard to imagine anyone not enjoying their stay at Raven's City Roost. My rating is A+.

review_text: Great place, easy to walk to many places. A tiny little view of mountain tops out the window on a clear day. Annie has done a great job of anticipating needs, stocking the kitchen, providing snacks, and, the all important emergency chocolate stash. It's easy to relax and feel comfortable here. Really comfortable, a good stay.
